activities: Smith & Nephew handles personal data transferred from countries in the European Economic Area (EEA) and Switzerland to the United States that are collected or received in managing Visionaire customer activities, including details about treating physicians and patient records
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Visionaire customer and patient data (off-line, on-line, manually processed data)
recoursemech:
In case of disputes, individuals are able to seek resolution of their questions or complaints regarding use and disclosure of their Personal Information in accordance with the principles contained in our privacy policy. If you feel that Smith & Nephew is not abiding by this policy or is not in compliance with the Safe Harbor principles, please contact Smith & Nephew in the first instance.  Smith & Nephew has further committed to refer unresolved privacy complaints to the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”) (ICDR/AAA Safe Harbor Program) for international mediation, and then if necessary to binding arbitration for final resolution. If you do not receive timely acknowledgment of your complaint, or if your complaint is not satisfactorily addressed by Smith & Nephew, you may contact the ICDR/AAA Safe Harbor Program at the address below:
American Arbitration Association
1633 Broadway, 10th Floor
New York, New York 10019
Phone:  +1 800 778 7879
Web: www.adr.org
